Name: CD3zeta deficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that affects the development and function of T cells.

Name: janus kinase-3 deficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that is characterized by severe cell-mediated and antibody-mediated immunodeficiency with recurrent bacterial

Name: MHC class I deficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that is characterized by recurrent bacterial

Name: Omenn syndrome
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that has_material_basis in the RAG1 and RAG2 genes on chromosome 11p and the Artemis gene on chromosome 10p. It is characterized by erythroderma

Name: recombinase activating gene 1 deficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that is the result of a mutation on Chromosome 6 RAG1 gene involving genetic rearrangement of both the T- and B-lymphocyte receptor genes.

Name: recombinase activating gene 2 deficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that is the result of a mutation on Chromosome 6 RAG2 gene involving genetic rearrangement of both the T- and B-lymphocyte receptor genes.

Name: X-linked severe combined immunodeficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that is a X-linked SCID that has_material_basis_in mutations in genes encoding common gamma chain proteins shared by the interleukin (IL-2

Name: CD45 deficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that is an autosomal recessive disease with T and B lymphocyte dysfunction

Name: interleukin-7 receptor alpha deficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that results from defective IL7R expression causes T-B+NK+ SCID. Loss of IL-7R function leads to the loss of an antiapoptotic signal

Name: CD3delta deficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that is characterized by the absence of T cells but normal numbers of B cells. CD3D is essential for T cell development.

Name: CD3epsilon deficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that has_material_basis_in autosomal recessive mutations in the gene coding for T-cell surface glycoprotein CD3epsilon chain precursors. Patients with CD3epsilon deficiency have a severe defect in the expression of the T-cell receptor CD3-complex.

Name: CD3gamma deficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that has_material_basis_in autosomal recessive mutations in the gene coding for T-cell surface glycoprotein CD3gamma chain precursors.  Patients with CD3gamma deficiency have a severe defect in the expression of the T-cell receptor CD3-complex. Affected patients have decreased T-cell numbers and function; B cells are variably affected.

Name: coronin-1A deficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that is an actin regulator when mutated results in SCID through inhibition of thymic egress of mature thymocytes into peripheral lymphoid organs.

Name: reticular dysgenesis
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that is the most severe form of SCID and has_material_basis_in mutations in the gene encoding mitochondrial adenylate kinase 2. It is characterized by congenital agranulocytosis

Name: T-cell immunodeficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency characterized by congenital alopecia

Name: severe combined immunodeficiency with sensitivity to ionizing radiation
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency characterized by being T cell-negative

Name: severe combined immunodeficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency characterized by being T cell-negative
Synonym: Severe combined immunodeficiency due to complete RAG1-2 deficiency

Name: severe combined immunodeficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency characterized by being T cell-negative

Name: adenosine deaminase deficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that is caused by a defective enzyme

Name: MHC class II deficiency
Definition: A severe combined immunodeficiency that is characterized by deficiency of MHC class II molecules that causes lack of immune protection against bacteria
Synonym: SCID due to absent class II HLA antigens
